name: Pesto Puff Pastry Pinwheel
author: Magda
summary: With three main ingredients you can make this gorgeous giant puff pastry pinwheel in no time. Pesto and ricotta fill layers of puff pastry that are cut and twisted into a pinwheel which begs to be pulled apart!
ingredients: 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour, or as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a baking tray with parchment paper and dust lightly with flour
Lay puff pastry on a flat work surface; cut a 12-inch circle from each sheet
Transfer 1 circle to the prepared baking sheet
Spread ricotta evenly over the pastry circle
Top with an even layer of pesto
Lay the second pastry circle on top
Set a small glass upside down in the middle of the circle
Cut the circle, away from the glass, into 4 equal quarters
Cut each quarter in half, then each eighth in half, to make 16 equal strips
Twist strips twice, two at a time, in the opposite direction
Repeat with remaining strips to make a pinwheel shape
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is browned, 25 to 30 minutes
